messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] FL
messages.messageBody:
>From: "Denese Kolb" <DCOLB@...>

<<Where in South FL are you Mary? I am hoping if I move a little bit south
every few years, I'll die in the Keys:)
The laws here do seem to be more hs friendly than some other states I have
read about.>>


Denese, I live in Hollywood, just south of Fort Lauderdale. I find people
generally very receptive to homeschooling here. Haven't had a problem with
anyone I meet regarding this, whether I run into them at the park, museum,
playhouse or whatever. Most resistence I had came from the in laws!!

Mary B

messages.subject: FL
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/19/02 5:15:16 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/19/02 5:15:16 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< The laws here do seem to be more hs friendly than some other states I have
read abou >>

Yeah, they are especially nice if you sign up under an umbrella school. No
laws to bother with after that.
Or you could just be a rebel and ignore the damn things.....:)

Ren
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
And remember,
"A life lived in fear is a life half lived"

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] FL
messages.msgSnippet: Where in South FL are you Mary? I am hoping if I move a little bit south every few years, I ll die in the Keys:) The laws here do seem to be more hs friendly
messages.messageBody:
Where in South FL are you Mary? I am hoping if I move a little bit south every few years, I'll die in the Keys:)
The laws here do seem to be more hs friendly than some other states I have read about.
Denese
----- Original Message -----
From: Mary Bianco
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, November 19, 2002 1:18 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] FL



I'm in south FL which is generally warmer than the Orlando area. I hate
anything below 60. Of course I deal with it, but I don't like it. My ideal
temp would actually be 75-80 during the day and 65-70 at night.
I don't know how I survived for 19 years in western PA. I guess being down
here for 25 years almost qualifies me as a native. My body believes it!!

Mary B (who loves the hs laws here and the wonderful support group I have.)
